description:
Kindaichi Hajime may look dumb, but he is one of the smartest you will ever see. He encounters mysteries after mysteries with his good friend, Miyuki, and he swears to solve them in the name of his grandfather, which was a great detective.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Website](http://www.kaoru-wada.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaoru_wadash) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4zbQfESCpBlXi1XlpnlG95)

He is a Japanese music composer. Married to voice actress [Akiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95749/Akiko-Nakagawa).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/@tanusuke45) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kōnosuke_Uda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇田鋼之介)

He graduated from the Animation Department of Tokyo Design Academy and worked as a freelancer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). He currently works mainly for [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

**[Madhouse Profile](http://www.madhouse.co.jp/special/mhpf/mhpf_no028.html)**

**Inoue Toshiki** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Araki developed an interest for drawing at age five. He graduated in Aichi Prefecture. In 1955, at age eighteen, he debuted as a cartoonist in the "Machi" magazine. He then joined Mushi Production as animator in 1964 and later founded Studio Jaccard in 1966. In 1970, he debuted as animation director on [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2402/), and later worked on the anime adaptations of several of [Gou Nagai](https://anilist.co/staff/97992/)'s manga, including [Devilman](https://anilist.co/anime/2252/), [Cutie Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/1661/), and [UFO Robo Grendizer](https://anilist.co/anime/1985/), serving as a character designer on the latter two. In 1971 he founded Studio Z together with his friends in the business.

He frequently worked with animator [Michi Himeno](https://anilist.co/staff/113357/), who he met in 1973. Araki formed Araki Production in 1974 and Himeno was the first member of the studio.

Araki was also an animator on several American productions which outsourced animation work to Japan, including Mighty Orbots (1984, key animation), The Adventures of the American Rabbit (1986) and G.I. Joe: The Movie (1987).

He passed away due to heart failure on December 1, 2011.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gennjousannzou)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Freelance since 2001.

node.description: Ryutaro Arimura (vocals) Akira Nakayama (guitar) Tadashi Hasegawa (bass) KenKen Satou (drums)  Plastic Tree (プラスティック トゥリ) is a Japanese rock band which formed in December 1993 in Chiba Prefecture, Japan.They released their first mini-album in December 1995, and in 1997, they debuted by releasing their first single on a major label.

node.description: Ryutaro Arimura (vocals) Akira Nakayama (guitar) Tadashi Hasegawa (bass) KenKen Satou (drums)  Plastic Tree (プラスティック トゥリ) is a Japanese rock band which formed in December 1993 in Chiba Prefecture, Japan.They released their first mini-album in December 1995, and in 1997, they debuted by releasing their first single on a major label.

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hide_manwa)

node.description: Platinum Peppers Family was a Japanese rock band that formed in 1995 and disbanded in 1999.

__Education__:
- 1987: Waseda University School of Economics & Political Science
- Tokyo Metropolitan Musashi Senior High School

__Pennames__: 
- [Agi Tadashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105010/Tadashi-Agi), shared with his older sister, Yuko Kibayashi (樹林ゆう子), non-fiction writer.
- Seimaru Amagi (_天樹征丸_)
- Yuma Ando (_安童夕馬_)
- Yuya Aoki (_青樹佑夜_)
- Joji Arimori (_有森丈時_)
- Hiroaki Igano (_伊賀大晃_)
- Ryo Ryumon (_龍門諒_)
- S.K.

Received the Kodansha Manga Award for Shounen in 1995 (The Kindaichi Case Files) and in 2003 (Kunimitsu no Matsuri).
